author: n0price
content:
I have a few question regarding the MaxEB

1. Validators with a 0x02 withdrawal address can set or adjust a custom MAX_EFFECTIVE_BALANCE below the proposed upper limit of 2,048 ETH (in multiples of 32), correct?

2. Once a validator (with a 0x02 withdrawal address) surpasses this set balance, any excess (CL rewards) is automatically sent to the withdrawal address, correct?

3. To use MAX_EFFECTIVE_BALANCE, validators must switch to the 0x02 withdrawal credential prefix. This can be done using one of the following options:

EIP-7804: Update the existing withdrawal address from 0x01 to 0x02 (no loss of rewards). However, this doesn't seem to be included in the first Pectra upgrade, correct?

EIP-7002: Perform an EL exit for the existing validator and create a new validator with 0x02 (no loss of rewards), correct?

Normal exit: Exit normally and create a new validator with 0x02 (results in a loss of rewards), correct?

author: jtraglia
content:
1. Not correct. There are no custom max effective balances.

2. Yes, excess balance will be "swept" into the withdrawal address.

3a. Not sure about the EIP numbers, but to convert a 0x01 validator to a 0x02 validator you would submit a consolidation request where the source and target public keys are the same. There should be no lost rewards this way. See here: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/electra/beacon-chain.md#new-is_valid_switch_to_compounding_request

3b. I believe you will be able to exit & create a new 0x02 validator too. And yes, I would expect some lost rewards if you went this route.
